author: raz
title: Asia Stakepool Alliance
description: Asia has +50% of the global population + the most populated cities globally. A Stakepool Alliance to support single SPOs in Asia to promote greater decentralization of the Cardano network is lacking.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal is a great first step to have SPO Alliance in East Asia. This will bring and increase the participation of the Cardano community with East Asian residents. It is quite an ambitious project and a big challenge as in the future they will be targeting financial institutions, corporates, and Private Equity and Venture Capital Fund managers to name a few to be delegators in the East Asia SPO Alliance. There will be potential of increasing the number of Stake Pools and SPOs based in East Asia if the team able to pull together great SPOs. Therefore, this project will be able to scale significantly around the Asia. Furthermore, the team are around the world with different time zones for this project and this will promote decentralization. The team have stated several risks in carrying out this project and their solution is reasonable with dividing the workload among the team members around the globe.
f6_assessments.q1: The team have provided their team members and they are quite experienced in this area. They are co-founders of many well-known Cardano projects. The team have outlined their timeline for this proposal. The team wants to establish panels to evaluate “proof-of-soul” for community projects and verify SPOs securities within a month which I think it is too fast. The team will also be working with other SPOs from previous F6 and F7 across the world with different time zones. To be on the safe side, the team can have a slightly longer timeframe at early stage for the project to be successful. However, the whole project takes a 12-month window to complete. The team can produce a Gantt Chart on how they are allocating their time to execute this project. The team will be publishing open-source documents on how peer review happens for projects and stake pools. This is good as it promotes the ethos of Cardano and cryptocurrency. The team have broken down their budget for this project. However, I think budget requested is not enough because 1) this is a 12-months project which requires a lot of resources 2) working with people in the Cardano ecosystem with different time zones 3) The team members are co-founders of other projects which takes up their time and energy 4) possibility that they tend to increase their manpower to execute this project, which may need to pay them for working on this project 5) sustainability, security and honesty of the joined SPOs Alliance. I see the success of the project in the long term as more people across Asia are connected and coming together to grow Cardano ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q2: The audibility for this proposal is easily done by the Cardano community by checking the no. of SPOs joined in the alliance, no. of ADA delegated to the alliance and no. of partnerships with the Cardano ecosystem. The team will produce a publicly accessible information in Google forms/sheets for their metric stated above. Suggestions to the team is to have a consistent update (weekly/bi-weekly/monthly) to the community on their progress using blogs, Town Halls, and AMAs in Twitter or Discord. Furthermore, the team can add a matrix in their Google sheet about the SPOs that joined. Matrix that has the mission and how trustful those SPOs are. Also, the team need a metric of how to sustain and maintain the SPO Alliance.

f6_assessments.q0:
In Asia where 50% of the global population is located, the percentage of pools operating in Asia is also quite low, which is also a difficulty and challenge for the Cardano ecosystem. The proposal is made to bridge the gap between the Cardano ecosystem of single miners, the world of impact investing and will be the proxies; create a cooperative alliance, combine and share resources, effectively create opportunities for investors not only to recover their investment, but also to have a positive impact on society and the environment.
Single SPOs play an important and integral role in ensuring that Cardano remains a secure and decentralized network. Mission-oriented teams are also at the frontier of paradigm shift in breaking down legacy systems and financial steering methods to solve local and global problems. Single operating SPOs everywhere are struggling, they don't attract more delegates to their team, so it becomes more economically difficult to operate the Pool and not feasible for many People. Therefore, the proposal to create a coalition from individual groups can also explore the general research published by IOHK that proposes the Conlave idea, a formal design of a collective stakeholder group but without an agency. sole power.
With specific examples as above, this proposal has effectively solved the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
The writer and team that wrote this proposal are members of the Cardano community actively working to advance the ecosystem for positive impact purposes, 14 years of experience as an international interdisciplinary educator with background in social sciences and humanities.
The budget of the application is very clear, detailed and reasonable with $36,910 to fund the project management; website registration; marketing campaigns for SPOs and projects; security review process; group network coordination; communication center management; documentation and translation of documents into multiple languages; preferential fees for SPOs.
The detailed plan and progress of the proposal is carried out in 3 months with a long-term vision of 6 months and 12 months, each roadmap has specific content to bring about the success of the proposal. Managing workloads with a decentralized, experienced, multi-skill and globally diverse team, working across time zones and connected to different networks and communities, can exploit harness their many connections and resources to ensure a sustainable approach as they receive funding from Catalyst. That gives confidence to the proposal to succeed when it is funded.
I see the proponent has made very clear arguments about the risks in the implementation process and measures to limit the risks when implementing to make the project successful. The risks identified by the proposal include management work and the amount of diversity among team members when they are in multiple countries with different time zones, and consistent communication and meetings will lead to success. work for the project. Team members must then be clearly aware of their individual responsibilities and plan accordingly to meet project expectations.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal provides a roadmap, detailed plan with the establishment of a council of project colleagues, a council of SPOs to verify security, configuration and assurance of candidate stake pools. member is following best practice; establish best practices for wallet management and escrow allocation between stake pools and projects.
Measuring project success among stakeholders outside the Cardano ecosystem and pool operators thanks to the Stakepool alliance in Asia, the increase in the number of new staking proxies per SPO, and the total the amount in ADA increases when participating in staking with each SPO. Therefore, the information provided is sufficient to assess the progress and success of the proposal.
Relying on the support of Catalyst funding and the Cardano community, the proposal will enable the team with the resources and capacity to direct the focused efforts that facilitate significant ADA capital inflows and diversions. Capital from Cardano community stakeholders and outsiders came to the Cardano ecosystem in light of the marketing efforts of newly trained SPOs and support from the Asia Stakepool alliance.
The success of the proposal is also reflected in the goal of sustainable development, ensuring the quality of inclusive and equitable education and promoting lifelong learning opportunities for all; building resilient infrastructure, promoting sustainable inclusive industrialization; reduce inequality between countries, between Asia and the rest of the world.

f6_assessments.q0:
"Building Asia Stakepool Alliance" the theme of the proposal meets the challenge requirement.
The solution is to create a cooperative integrity that combines and shares resources efficiently.
Bridging the gap with single investors with the Cardano community
An Asian Stakepool Alliance will make the Cardano community truly grow. Cardano materials will be provided to the community in Asian countries, human resources will be shared and experienced to become more and more professional and high quality. More importantly their projects will have access to Catalyst and continue to grow.
The goal is to improve digital and financial literacy among members and populations, and social justice, regardless of race or color, brings a lot of value to the community.
Projects for Asian communities, continents with billions of people, managing responsibilities and workloads will be very risky. The biggest risk is compliance with the laws of the host country. These are just 2 of many risks that propose to offer solutions, I agree with you
I was overwhelmed by the sheer size of the community on this project. I hope you will succeed
f6_assessments.q1:
ith the detailed timetable given 4 months, I think that is not enough time for you to implement this project because of the proposal to build the integrity of Asia, not just one country. But with the team that has developed many projects that have received funding from the Fund before, I think that the completion is not without foundation.
Team members are all members of the Cardano community, very active in promoting the development ecosystem, talented and enthusiastic personnel.
The details of the work each month are clearly defined, so I visualize the detailed plan of the proposal with the goal of developing SPOs in Asia,
Detailed budget table allocated for all stages.
The team with a detailed plan shows that the project is feasible
f6_assessments.q2:
Success is developing shared decentralized integrity, all for the sake of developing the Cardano ecosystem,
Public statements also show project progress. I feel that if this project develops successfully, there will be a strong and united Asian alliance community, there will be many proposals to join Catalyst and there will also be many projects that benefit Asia.
f6_assessments.reply: Thank you for taking the time to assess our proposal. It is unclear as to why a 4 is given and not a 5 for Auditability

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal seeks to develop an Asia Stakepool Alliance to bridge the gap between the Cardano ecosystem of single pool operators. 
The problem statement clearly shows a problem to be solved. To solve the problem, the proposal explained that a structured and organized  Asia Stakepool Alliance can bring about many benefits to the Cardano community at large.
In addressing the challenge, the proposal has shown that with the support of this Catalyst proposal and the Cardano community, developing the Asia Stakepool Alliance to equip and empower populations across the world's most populated continent (Asia).
Also this proposal will work to bring all interested members (SPOs) in the ecosystem to be part of the groups of 'founding members' to lay the groundwork and continue building towards a common vision and mission of a better world, not just those in Asia, but the whole world. 
Risks and mitigating measures have been outlined in the proposal. One of the outlined risks is their fear of working in a space with legal and financial uncertainty . But mitigating measure is that they will find the appropriate legal and financial professionals to deliver. 
With the elaborate facts above, the proposal has addressed the challenge effectively. My rating is 5.
f6_assessments.q1:
There is a detailed plan in this proposal. The duration of this proposal has a short term of 3 months and a long term from 6 till 12 months.
The 3 months have been divided into monthly timelines with specific activities from September to November 2022. 
Deliverables for the project have been outlined comprehensively.
The budget total of $36910 is reasonable and has been broken down well, with the highest cost of $12000 allotted to project management..
The team is made up of 2 strong members of the Cardano community- Raz and Baba Elliot- who are experienced Cardano community members.  Raz has experience in blockchain, and also sustainability and impact measurements Researcher. 
Baba Elliot is also an active member of the Cardano Community and Catalyst Proposal Assessor. LinkedIn links to their profiles and experiences have been provided for reference. Other supporting team members have also been listed with their names and LinkedIn profile links. 
The proposal indicated that they are not 100% certain about returning to Catalyst for support in future projects, and are also part of proposals in previous funds and current Fund9.
Given the experiences of the team and the detailed plan, this proposal is likely to be implemented successfully. My rating is 5
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal has given details about how they will measure the progress of the proposal through the number of of existing Asia based single Stakepool operators joining the Alliance and also the number of new Asia based single Stakepool operators that are created with the help of the Asia Stakepool Alliance and join the Alliance, to mention a few. 
Their monthly reports will be sent to google sheets data base for the community for reference.
For success, the proposer wants to see that this project would have enabled the team to have the resources and capacity to direct focused efforts that facilitate a significant inflow and redirection of ADA, and capital from Stake holders that were external to the Cardano ecosystem before the proposition of the Asia Stakepool  Alliance; ADA flowing to Stakepool operators; grand vision of Charles Hoskinson realized and change makers able to drive positive action with the support of a decentralized network.
The information provided in this proposal is sufficient to audit the progress and success of the proposal, so I rate it 5.

f6_assessments.q0: Yes, This proposal very effectively address the challenge of growing Cardano in east Asia. The proposers are planning to develop an east Asian stake pool alliance and cooperative. This proposal has a lot of resources to attract engagement from SPO's which is the backbone of the Cardano Blockchain. This Proposal aligns with the stated goals of this challenge and is in the appropriate category.
f6_assessments.q1: Yes, The proposal has displayed the talents of the team and based on previous work this project seems highly likely to succeed. The plan is very detailed and has a lot of information about their planning. The thought that went into this idea is enough to justify the seriousness of the proposers. I think this plan could definitely be implemented successfully. They set aside large portion of budget as incentives to increase engagement which is a good strategy for success.
f6_assessments.q2: Yes, The information in this proposal is sufficient to audit the progress and success of this proposal. The proposal includes measures for success by counting the number of new SPO's in asia. The project would also be able to publicly display how much ADA has been delegated to the pools in the alliance in order to calculate growth. They plan to incorporate all data into a website for public audibility. They have clear metrics for what the project defines as success.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal effectively addresses the challenge. It talks about creating an Asian StakePool Alliance with the aim of bringing single stake pool operators together on a bigger platform. This will help people in east Asia to participate in stake pool activities in the Cardano ecosystem. Since Asia is the most populated continent in the world, creating a Stakepool which is specifically tailored for the Asian market is ver laudable. This initiative will definitely bridge the gap of stakepool activities in the Cardano ecosystem. It will as well let Asian ADA holders as well as other asset holders  to confidently take part in stakepooling activities on the Cardano ecosystem. For this reason I give this proposal a 5 star rating.
f6_assessments.q1:
The team behind this proposal are quite experienced looking at the projects they are working on and the ones they have completed. The team involved in the execution of the project is very diverse from almost all the continents in the world. The plan to effectively collaborate with other stakepools on the Cardano ecosystem is a step in the right direction. 

The budget provided is also reasonable and realistic as well as the timeline given to complete the project. 
This proposal though a new one, is being built on previously funded proposals there by giving it the firm foundation to take off. 

I therefore believe that this proposal will be implemented successfully when funded. For that matter I will give it a 5 star rating
f6_assessments.q2:
The team intends to update the catalyst community periodically using both their social media handles and on the catalyst community. 

It has clear and logical milestones within which the project will be completed. 
The key metrics given will also make it easy for the community to measure both progress and success of the project. Auditing this proposal wouldn’t be a challenge therefore I give it a 4 star rating
f6_assessments.reply: Thank you for taking the time to assess our proposal. It is unclear why you have given a 4 and not a 5 for Auditability based on your notes.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal identifies the problem very clear and articulates very well how this project could add value to the Cardano ecosystem. I do believe that Stakepool Allieance is an important thing. I do see the goals that this proposal offer could really helpful for investors/delegators. It is a very long project and many collaboration need to be done, but it is a good project and will bring good value in the long run.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer provides references, link and the record of winning F5, 6, 7, 8. The budget also outlined clearly and broken down into identifiable items. The budget also reasonable to achieve the set goals. One thing that make me wonder is the different between the roadmap and the budget. The proposal only give 3 months roadmap, while they asked for 12 months budget for project management and website cost. It need to be adjusted to 3 months budget for this term. Great timeline with a sensible and conductible plan for implementation and also describing the resources needed to implement the proposal. The proposer also has considered challenges and risks relevant to a successful implementation.
f6_assessments.q2: The metrics/KPIs are great and achievable. I think it still important to have an accessible public channel to report monthly to the communities. The proposal describe the measurable targets and the same time offer good solutions to the problem. This proposal can help to expand communities and create a better environment for the community and ecosystem of Cardano.

solution: Develop an Asia Stakepool Alliance, open access database and framework for knowledge exchange, facilitating + increasing impact of mission driven SPOs operating in Asia and the diaspora.
experience: 200+ team of active Cardano community members. Single Pool Operators, Cardano AIM team (SDG Proposer Tool, SDG Search Tool). Globally diverse multidisciplinary team of professionals: Catalyst, sustainability and impact research. Fund 5,6,7,8 winners.
